property.name: content
property.content: transparent (either phrasing content or flow content)

property.name: description
property.content: The a element represents a hyperlink.

property.name: Accessibility techniques
property.content: Providing link text that describes the purpose of a link for anchor elements

property.name: QA Tip
property.content: Donʼt use “click here” as link text

property.name: description
property.content: The abbr element represents an abbreviation or acronym.

property.name: Accessibility techniques
property.content: Providing definitions for abbreviations by using the abbr and acronym elements

property.name: description
property.content: The address element represents contact information.

property.name: description
property.content: The area element represents either a hyperlink with some text and a corresponding area on an image map, or a dead area on an image map.

property.name: Accessibility techniques
property.content: Providing text alternatives for the area elements of image maps

property.name: Mobile considerations
property.content: Do not use image maps unless you know the device supports them effectively.

property.name: content
property.content: zero or more style elements, followed by flow content

property.name: description
property.content: The article element represents a section of content that forms an independent part of a document or site; for example, a magazine or newspaper article, or a blog entry.

property.name: content
property.content: zero or more style elements, followed by flow content

property.name: description
property.content: The aside element represents content that is tangentially related to the content that forms the main textual flow of a document.

property.name: content
property.content: a src attribute, or one or more source elements followed by zero or more track elements, followed by flow content
a src attribute, or one or more source elements followed by zero or more track elements, followed by phrasing content

property.name: description
property.content: An audio element represents an audio stream.

property.name: description
property.content: The b element represents a span of text offset from its surrounding content without conveying any extra emphasis or importance, and for which the conventional typographic presentation is bold text; for example, keywords in a document abstract, or product names in a review.

property.name: description
property.content: The base element specifies a document-wide base URL for the purposes of resolving relative URLs, and a document-wide default browsing context name for the purposes of following hyperlinks.

property.name: description
property.content: The bdi element represents a span of text that is isolated from its surroundings for the purposes of bidirectional text formatting [BIDI].

property.name: description
property.content: The bdo element represents an explicit text directionality formatting control for its children; it provides a means to specify a direction override of the Unicode BiDi algorithm [BIDI].

property.name: Internationalization
property.content: Creating HTML Pages in Arabic, Hebrew and Other Right-to-left Scripts

property.name: description
property.content: The blockquote element represents a section that is quoted from another source.

property.name: description
property.content: The body element represents the body of a document (as opposed to the document’s metadata).

property.name: description
property.content: The br element represents a line break.

property.name: Accessibility techniques
property.content: Using ol, ul and dl for lists or groups of links

property.name: description
property.content: The button element with a type attribute whose value is "submit" represents a button for submitting a form.

property.name: Accessibility techniques
property.content: Using label elements to associate text labels with form controls
Using HTML form controls and links

property.name: description
property.content: The button element with a type attribute whose value is "reset" represents a button for resetting a form.

property.name: Accessibility techniques
property.content: Using label elements to associate text labels with form controls
Using HTML form controls and links

property.name: description
property.content: The button element with a type attribute whose value is "button" represents a button with no additional semantics.

property.name: Accessibility techniques
property.content: Using label elements to associate text labels with form controls
Using HTML form controls and links

property.name: content
property.content: transparent (either phrasing content or flow content)

property.name: description
property.content: The canvas element represents a resolution-dependent bitmap canvas, which can be used for dynamically rendering of images such as game graphics, graphs, or other images.

property.name: description
property.content: The caption element represents the title of the table that is its parent.

property.name: Accessibility techniques
property.content: Using caption elements to associate data table captions with data tables
Using the summary attribute of the table element to give an overview of data tables

property.name: description
property.content: The cite element represents the cited title of a work; for example, the title of a book mentioned within the main text flow of a document.

property.name: description
property.content: The code element represents a fragment of computer code.

property.name: description
property.content: The col element represents one or more columns in the column group represented by its colgroup parent.

property.name: content
property.content: zero or more col elements, or an optional span attribute

property.name: description
property.content: The colgroup element represents a group of one or more columns in the table that is its parent.

property.name: description
property.content: The command element with a type attribute whose value is "command" represents a command with an associated action.

property.name: description
property.content: The command element with a type attribute whose value is "radio" represents a selection of one item from a list of items.

property.name: description
property.content: The command element with a type attribute whose value is "checkbox" represents a state or option that can be toggled.

property.name: content
property.content: zero or more option elements, intermixed with phrasing content

property.name: description
property.content: The datalist element represents a set of option elements that represent predefined options for other controls.

property.name: description
property.content: The dd element represents a description or value.

property.name: content
property.content: transparent (either phrasing content or flow content)

property.name: description
property.content: The del element represents a range of text that has been deleted from a document.

property.name: content
property.content: an optional summary element, followed by flow content

property.name: description
property.content: The details element represents a control from which the user can obtain additional information or controls on-demand.

property.name: description
property.content: The dfn element represents the defining instance of a term.

property.name: Accessibility techniques
property.content: Using the dfn element to identify the defining instance of a word

property.name: content
property.content: zero or more style elements, followed by flow content

property.name: description
property.content: The div element is a generic container for flow content that by itself does not represent anything.

property.name: content
property.content: zero or more of: one or more dt elements, followed by one or more dd elements

property.name: description
property.content: The dl element represents a description list.

property.name: Accessibility techniques
property.content: Using ol, ul and dl for lists or groups of links

property.name: description
property.content: The dt element represents a term or name.

property.name: description
property.content: The em element represents a span of text with emphatic stress.

property.name: description
property.content: The embed element represents an integration point for external content.

property.name: content
property.content: an optional legend element, followed by flow content

property.name: description
property.content: The fieldset element represents a set of form controls grouped under a common name.

property.name: Accessibility techniques
property.content: Providing a description for groups of form controls using fieldset and legend elements

property.name: Mobile considerations
property.content: Label all form controls appropriately and explicitly associate labels with form controls.

property.name: description
property.content: The figcaption element represents a caption or legend for a figure.

property.name: content
property.content: one figcaption element, followed by flow content or flow content followed by an optional figcaption element

property.name: description
property.content: The figure element represents a unit of content, optionally with a caption, that is self-contained, that is typically referenced as a single unit from the main flow of the document, and that can be moved away from the main flow of the document without affecting the document’s meaning.

property.name: description
property.content: The footer element represents the footer for the section it applies to.

property.name: description
property.content: The form element represents a user-submittable form.

property.name: Mobile considerations
property.content: Label all form controls appropriately and explicitly associate labels with form controls.

property.name: description
property.content: The h1 through h6 elements are headings for the sections with which they are associated.

property.name: QA Tip
property.content: Use headings to structure your document

property.name: description
property.content: The h1 through h6 elements are headings for the sections with which they are associated.

property.name: QA Tip
property.content: Use headings to structure your document

property.content: The h1 through h6 elements are headings for the sections with which they are associated.

property.content: The h1 through h6 elements are headings for the sections with which they are associated.

property.content: The h1 through h6 elements are headings for the sections with which they are associated.

property.content: Use headings to structure your document

property.name: description
property.content: The h1 through h6 elements are headings for the sections with which they are associated.

property.name: QA Tip
property.content: Use headings to structure your document

property.name: content
property.content: one title element, intermixed with an optional base element, intermixed with metadata elements

property.name: description
property.content: The head element collects the document’s metadata.

property.name: Accessibility techniques
property.content: Providing a title using the title element
Using the link element to link to a glossary

property.name: description
property.content: The header element represents the header of a section.

property.name: content
property.content: one or more of: one h1 element, or one h2 element, or one h3 element, or one h4 element, or one h5 element, or one h6 element

property.name: description
property.content: The hgroup element represents a group of headings.

property.name: description
property.content: The hr element represents a paragraph-level thematic break.

property.name: content
property.content: one head element, followed by one body element

property.name: description
property.content: The html element represents the root of a document.

property.name: Accessibility techniques
property.content: Using language attributes on the html element

property.name: description
property.content: The i element represents a span of text offset from its surrounding content without conveying any extra emphasis or importance, and for which the conventional typographic presentation is italic text; for example, a taxonomic designation, a technical term, an idiomatic phrase from another language, a thought, or a ship name.

property.name: description
property.content: The iframe element introduces a new nested browsing context.

property.name: Accessibility techniques
property.content: Using the title attribute of the frame and iframe elements

property.name: description
property.content: The img element represents an image.

property.name: Accessibility techniques
property.content: Using alt attributes on img elements

property.name: Mobile considerations
property.content: Do not use graphics for spacing.
Do not use images that cannot be rendered by the device. Avoid large or high resolution images except where critical information would otherwise be lost.
Provide a text equivalent for every non-text element.
Specify the size of images in markup, if they have an intrinsic size.
Resize images at the server, if they have an intrinsic size.

property.name: QA Tip
property.content: Use the alt attribute to describe the function of each visual

property.name: description
property.content: The input element with a type attribute whose value is "text" represents a one-line plain text edit control for the input element’s value.

property.name: Accessibility techniques
property.content: Using label elements to associate text labels with form controls
Using alt attributes on images used as submit buttons

property.name: Mobile considerations
property.content: Avoid free text entry where possible.
Provide pre-selected default values where possible.
Specify a default text entry mode, language and/or input format, if the target device is known to support it.
Label all form controls appropriately and explicitly associate labels with form controls.

property.name: description
property.content: The input element with a type attribute whose value is "password" represents a one-line plain-text edit control for entering a password.

property.name: content
property.content: transparent (either phrasing content or flow content)

property.name: description
property.content: The ins element represents a range of text that has been inserted (added) to a document.

property.name: description
property.content: The kbd element represents user input.

property.name: description
property.content: The keygen element represents a control for generating a public-private key pair and for submitting the public key from that key pair.

property.name: description
property.content: The label element represents a caption for a form control.

property.name: Accessibility techniques
property.content: Using label elements to associate text labels with form controls
Using HTML form controls and links

property.name: Mobile considerations
property.content: Label all form controls appropriately and explicitly associate labels with form controls.

property.name: description
property.content: The legend element represents a title or explanatory caption for the rest of the contents of the legend element’s parent element.

property.name: Accessibility techniques
property.content: Providing a description for groups of form controls using fieldset and legend elements

property.name: Mobile considerations
property.content: Label all form controls appropriately and explicitly associate labels with form controls.

property.name: description
property.content: The li element represents a list item.

property.name: description
property.content: The link element represents metadata that expresses inter-document relationships.

property.name: Accessibility techniques
property.content: Using the link element and navigation tools
Using the link element to link to a glossary

property.name: content
property.content: transparent (either phrasing content or flow content)

property.name: description
property.content: The map element, in conjunction with any area element descendants, defines an image map.

property.name: description
property.content: The mark element represents a run of text in one document marked or highlighted for reference purposes, due to its relevance in another context.

property.name: content
property.content: zero or more li elements, or flow content

property.name: description
property.content: The menu element represents a list of commands.

property.name: description
property.content: The meta element with a name attribute represents document metadata in the form of name/value pairs.

property.name: Accessibility techniques
property.content: Using meta refresh to create an instant client-side redirect

property.name: Mobile considerations
property.content: Do not create periodically auto-refreshing pages, unless you have informed the user and provided a means of stopping it.
Do not use markup to redirect pages automatically. Instead, configure the server to perform redirects by means of HTTP 3xx codes.

property.name: QA Tip
property.content: Use standard redirects: don't break the back button!

property.name: description
property.content: The meta element with a http-equiv attribute whose value is "refresh" represents a pragma directive that specifies either a number of seconds after which to reload the current page, or a number of seconds after which to load a different page in place of the current page, and the URL for the replacement page.

property.name: Accessibility techniques
property.content: Using meta refresh to create an instant client-side redirect

property.name: Mobile considerations
property.content: Do not create periodically auto-refreshing pages, unless you have informed the user and provided a means of stopping it.
Do not use markup to redirect pages automatically. Instead, configure the server to perform redirects by means of HTTP 3xx codes.

property.name: QA Tip
property.content: Use standard redirects: don't break the back button!

property.name: description
property.content: The meta element with a http-equiv attribute whose value is "default-style" represents a pragma directive that specifies the document’s preferred stylesheet.

property.name: Accessibility techniques
property.content: Using meta refresh to create an instant client-side redirect

property.name: Mobile considerations
property.content: Do not create periodically auto-refreshing pages, unless you have informed the user and provided a means of stopping it.
Do not use markup to redirect pages automatically. Instead, configure the server to perform redirects by means of HTTP 3xx codes.

property.name: QA Tip
property.content: Use standard redirects: don't break the back button!

property.name: description
property.content: The meta element with a charset attribute represents a character encoding declaration.

property.name: Accessibility techniques
property.content: Using meta refresh to create an instant client-side redirect

property.name: Mobile considerations
property.content: Do not create periodically auto-refreshing pages, unless you have informed the user and provided a means of stopping it.
Do not use markup to redirect pages automatically. Instead, configure the server to perform redirects by means of HTTP 3xx codes.

property.name: QA Tip
property.content: Use standard redirects: don't break the back button!

property.name: description
property.content: A meta element with a http-equiv attribute whose value is "content-type" and which has an accompanying content attribute and value represents a character encoding declaration.

property.name: Accessibility techniques
property.content: Using meta refresh to create an instant client-side redirect

property.name: Mobile considerations
property.content: Do not create periodically auto-refreshing pages, unless you have informed the user and provided a means of stopping it.
Do not use markup to redirect pages automatically. Instead, configure the server to perform redirects by means of HTTP 3xx codes.

property.name: QA Tip
property.content: Use standard redirects: don't break the back button!

property.name: description
property.content: The meter element represents a scalar gauge providing a measurement within a known range, or a fractional value.

property.name: description
property.content: The nav element represents a section of a document that links to other documents or to parts within the document itself; that is, a section of navigation links.

property.name: content
property.content: zero or more of: one link element, or one meta element, or one meta element, or one style element
transparent (either phrasing content or flow content)

property.name: description
property.content: The noscript element is used to present different markup to user agents that don’t support scripting, by affecting how the document is parsed.

property.name: content
property.content: zero or more param elements, followed by flow content
zero or more param elements, followed by phrasing content

property.name: description
property.content: The object element represents external content.

property.name: Accessibility techniques
property.content: Providing text and non-text alternatives for object

property.name: Mobile considerations
property.content: Provide a text equivalent for every non-text element.
Do not rely on embedded objects or script.

property.name: description
property.content: The ol element represents a list (or sequence) of items; that is, a list in which the items are intentionally ordered, such that changing the order would change the meaning of the list.

property.name: Accessibility techniques
property.content: Using ol, ul and dl for lists or groups of links

property.name: description
property.content: The optgroup element represents a group of option elements with a common label.

property.name: Accessibility techniques
property.content: Using OPTGROUP to group OPTION elements inside a SELECT

property.name: description
property.content: The option element represents an option in a select control, or an option in a labelled set of options grouped together in an optgroup, or an option among the list of suggestions in a datalist.

property.name: Accessibility techniques
property.content: Using OPTGROUP to group OPTION elements inside a SELECT

property.name: description
property.content: The output element represents the result of a calculation.

property.name: description
property.content: The p element represents a paragraph.

property.name: description
property.content: The param element defines parameters for plugins invoked by object elements.

property.name: description
property.content: The pre element represents a block of preformatted text, in which structure is represented by typographic conventions rather than by elements.

property.name: Accessibility techniques
property.content: Using table markup to present tabular information

property.name: description
property.content: The progress element represents the completion progress of a task.

property.name: description
property.content: The q element represents phrasing content quoted from another source.

property.name: description
property.content: The rp element can be used to provide parentheses around a ruby text component of a ruby annotation, to be shown by UAs that don’t support ruby annotations.

property.name: description
property.content: The rt element marks the ruby text component of a ruby annotation.

property.name: content
property.content: one or more of: phrasing content followed by one rt element, or one rp element, followed by one rt element, followed by one rp element

property.name: description
property.content: The ruby element allows spans of phrasing content to be marked with ruby annotations.

property.name: description
property.content: The s element represents contents that are no longer accurate or no longer relevant and that therefore has been “struck” from the document.

property.name: description
property.content: The samp element represents (sample) output from a program or computing system.

property.name: description
property.content: The script element enables dynamic script and data blocks to be included in documents.

property.name: content
property.content: zero or more style elements, followed by flow content

property.name: description
property.content: The section element represents a section of a document, typically with a title or heading.

property.name: content
property.content: zero or more optgroup elements, intermixed with zero or more option elements

property.name: description
property.content: The select element represents a control for selecting among a list of options.

property.name: Accessibility techniques
property.content: Using a button with a select element to perform an action
Using OPTGROUP to group OPTION elements inside a SELECT
Using label elements to associate text labels with form controls

property.name: Mobile considerations
property.content: Provide pre-selected default values where possible.
Label all form controls appropriately and explicitly associate labels with form controls.

property.name: description
property.content: The small element represents so-called “fine print” or “small print”, such as legal disclaimers and caveats.

property.name: description
property.content: The source element enables multiple media sources to be specified for audio and video elements.

property.name: description
property.content: The span element is a generic wrapper for phrasing content that by itself does not represent anything.

property.name: Accessibility techniques
property.content: Using the dir attribute on an inline element to resolve problems with nested directional runs

property.name: description
property.content: The strong element represents a span of text with strong importance.

property.name: description
property.content: The style element allows style information to be embedded in documents.

property.name: description
property.content: The summary element represents a summary, caption, or legend for a details element.

property.name: content
property.content: an optional caption element, followed by zero or more colgroup elements, followed by an optional thead element, followed by one tfoot element, followed by zero or more tbody elements, or one or more tr elements or zero or more tbody elements, or one or more tr elements followed by an optional tfoot element

property.name: description
property.content: The table element represents a table; that is, data with more than one dimension.

property.name: Accessibility techniques
property.content: Using the summary attribute of the table element to give an overview of data tables
Using caption elements to associate data table captions with data tables
Using table markup to present tabular information

property.name: Mobile considerations
property.content: Do not use tables unless the device is known to support them.
Do not use tables for layout.
Where possible, use an alternative to tabular presentation.

property.name: description
property.content: The tbody element represents a block of rows that consist of a body of data for its parent table element.

property.name: description
property.content: The td element represents a data cell in a table.

property.name: Accessibility techniques
property.content: Using the scope attribute to associate header cells and data cells in data tables
Using id and headers attributes to associate data cells with header cells in data tables
Using table markup to present tabular information

property.name: description
property.content: The textarea element represents a multi-line plain-text edit control for the element’s raw value.

property.name: Accessibility techniques
property.content: Using label elements to associate text labels with form controls

property.name: Mobile considerations
property.content: Avoid free text entry where possible.
Label all form controls appropriately and explicitly associate labels with form controls.

property.name: description
property.content: The tfoot element represents the block of rows that consist of the column summaries (footers) for its parent table element.

property.name: description
property.content: The th element represents a header cell in a table.

property.name: Accessibility techniques
property.content: Using the scope attribute to associate header cells and data cells in data tables
Using id and headers attributes to associate data cells with header cells in data tables
Using table markup to present tabular information

property.name: description
property.content: The thead element represents the block of rows that consist of the column labels (headings) for its parent table element.

property.name: description
property.content: The time element represents a date and/or time.

property.name: description
property.content: The title element represents the document’s title or name.

property.name: Accessibility techniques
property.content: Providing a title using the title element
Using the title attribute of the frame and iframe elements

property.name: Mobile considerations
property.content: Provide a short but descriptive page title.

property.name: QA Tip
property.content: <title>: the most important element of a quality Web page

property.name: content
property.content: zero or more of: one td element, or one th element

property.name: description
property.content: The tr element represents a row of cells in a table.

property.name: Accessibility techniques
property.content: Using table markup to present tabular information

property.name: description
property.content: The track element enables supplementary media tracks such as subtitle tracks and caption tracks to be specified for audio and video elements.

property.name: description
property.content: The u element represents a span of text offset from its surrounding content without conveying any extra emphasis or importance, and for which the conventional typographic presentation is underlining; for example, a span of text in Chinese that is a proper name (a Chinese proper name mark), or span of text that is known to be misspelled.

property.name: description
property.content: The ul element represents an unordered list of items; that is, a list in which changing the order of the items would not change the meaning of list.

property.name: Accessibility techniques
property.content: Using ol, ul and dl for lists or groups of links

property.name: QA Tip
property.content: Unordered lists: more than just bullets

property.name: description
property.content: The var element represents either a variable in a mathematical expression or programming context, or placeholder text that the reader is meant to mentally replace with some other literal value.

property.name: content
property.content: a src attribute, or one or more source elements followed by zero or more track elements, followed by flow content
a src attribute, or one or more source elements followed by zero or more track elements, followed by phrasing content

property.name: description
property.content: The video element represents a video or movie.

property.name: description
property.content: The wbr element represents a line-break opportunity.

property.name: Accessibility techniques
property.content: Providing definitions for abbreviations by using the abbr and acronym elements

property.name: Accessibility techniques

property.name: Mobile considerations
property.content: Do not cause pop-ups or other windows to appear and do not change the current window without informing the user.

property.name: description
property.content: The kind of menu being declared. "toolbar": Indicates that the element represents a tool bar. "context": Indicates that the element represents a context menu. If the attribute is omitted, the element represents a list of commands that is neither a context menu nor a tool bar.

property.content: The MIME type of the content.

property.name: description
property.content: The fallback content for the image.

property.name: description
property.content: Provides a textual label for an alternative button for users and UAs who cannot use the image specified by the src attribute.

property.name: description
property.content: Specifies that the shape of the area of this hyperlink on the image map is a rectangle.

property.name: description
property.content: Instructs the UA to automatically begin playback of the audio stream as soon as it can do so without stopping.

property.name: description
property.content: Instructs the UA to automatically begin playback of the video as soon as it can do so without stopping.

property.name: content
property.content: "none" or "metadata" or "auto" or "" (empty string) or empty

property.name: description
property.content: Represents a hint to the UA about whether optimistic downloading of the audio stream itself or its metadata is considered worthwhile. "none": Hints to the UA that the user is not expected to need the audio stream, or that minimizing unnecessary traffic is desirable. "metadata": Hints to the UA that the user is not expected to need the audio stream, but that fetching its metadata (duration and so on) is desirable. "auto": Hints to the UA that optimistically downloading the entire audio stream is considered desirable. Specifying the empty string is equivalent to specifying the value "auto".

property.name: content
property.content: "none" or "metadata" or "auto" or "" (empty string) or empty

property.name: description
property.content: Represents a hint to the UA about whether optimistic downloading of the video itself or its metadata is considered worthwhile. "none": Hints to the UA that the user is not expected to need the video, or that minimizing unnecessary traffic is desirable. "metadata": Hints to the UA that the user is not expected to need the video, but that fetching its metadata (dimensions, first frame, track list, duration, and so on) is desirable. "auto": Hints to the UA that optimistically downloading the entire video is considered desirable. Specifying the empty string is equivalent to specifying the value "auto".

property.name: description
property.content: Instructs the UA to expose a user interface for controlling playback of the audio stream.

property.name: description
property.content: Instructs the UA to expose a user interface for controlling playback of the video.

property.name: description
property.content: Instructs the UA to seek back to the start of the audio stream upon reaching the end.

property.name: description
property.content: Instructs the UA to seek back to the start of the video upon reaching the end.

property.name: description
property.content: Instructs the UA to link multiple videos and/or audio streams together.

property.content: A short hint (one word or a short phrase) intended to aid the user when entering data into the control represented by its element.

property.name: description
property.content: Provides the UA with a hint of what file types the server is able to accept.

property.name: description
property.content: Specifies that the element allows multiple values.

property.name: description
property.content: If present, indicates that its select element represents a control for selecting zero or more options from a list of options.

property.content: Label all form controls appropriately and explicitly associate labels with form controls.

property.name: description
property.content: Specifies the value part of a name/value pair.

property.name: Accessibility techniques
property.content: Using meta refresh to create an instant client-side redirect

property.name: description
property.content: Indicates that the meta element is a pragma directive that specifies either a number of seconds after which to reload the current page, or a number of seconds after which to load a different page in place of the current page, and the URL for the replacement page.

property.name: Accessibility techniques
property.content: Using meta refresh to create an instant client-side redirect

property.name: Mobile considerations
property.content: Do not create periodically auto-refreshing pages, unless you have informed the user and provided a means of stopping it.
Do not use markup to redirect pages automatically. Instead, configure the server to perform redirects by means of HTTP 3xx codes.

property.name: QA Tip
property.content: Use standard redirects: don't break the back button!

property.name: description
property.content: The character encoding of the external script.

property.name: description
property.content: The point that marks the upper boundary of the “low” segment of the meter.

property.name: description
property.content: The point that marks the lower boundary of the “high” segment of the meter.

property.name: description
property.content: The point that marks the “optimum” position for the meter.

property.content: Non-empty URL potentially surrounded by spaces

property.name: description
property.content: The ordinal value of the first list item.

property.name: description
property.content: If present, indicates that the list is a descending list (…, 3, 2, 1).

property.name: description
property.content: Specifies that this option is pre-selected.

property.name: description
property.content: Specifies that the language of the script is JavaScript.

property.name: description
property.content: Specifies that script should be executed after the document has been parsed.

property.name: description
property.content: Specifies that the script should be executed asynchronously, as soon as it becomes available.

property.name: description
property.content: Indicates that the specified style information is meant to apply only to the style element’s parent element, and that element’s child nodes. Otherwise, the specified styles are meant to apply to the entire document.

property.name: description
property.content: Specifies the number of adjacent columns “spanned” by its td element.

property.name: description
property.content: Specifies the number of adjacent columns “spanned” by its th element.

property.name: description
property.content: Specifies the number of following rows “spanned” by its td element.

property.name: description
property.content: Specifies the number of following rows “spanned” by its th element.

property.name: description
property.content: Identifies one or more th elements that apply to its td.

property.name: Accessibility techniques
property.content: Using id and headers attributes to associate data cells with header cells in data tables

property.name: description
property.content: Identifies one or more th elements that apply to its th.

property.name: description
property.content: The number of lines of text for the UA to show.

property.name: description
property.content: Instructs the UA to insert line breaks into the submitted value of the textarea such that each line has no more characters than the value specified by the cols attribute.

property.name: description
property.content: The expected maximum number of characters per line of text for the UA to show.

property.name: description
property.content: Specifies what set of cells the th element applies to.

property.name: Accessibility techniques
property.content: Using the scope attribute to associate header cells and data cells in data tables
Using id and headers attributes to associate data cells with header cells in data tables

property.name: description
property.content: Indicates that the date and time given by the element is the publication date and time of the nearest ancestor article element — or, if the element has no ancestor article element, of the document as a whole.

property.name: description
property.content: The kind of timed track. "subtitles": Transcription or translation of the dialogue in the soundtrack of the video or audio stream; meant for users who have access to the soundtrack but for whom it is not fully usable as intended (for example, for users who do not understand the language of the soundtrack). "captions": Transcription or translation of the dialogue, sound effects, relevant musical cues, and other relevant aural information in the video or audio stream; intended for cases where users do not have any access at all to the soundtrack (for example, for users who are deaf or for the case when the soundtrack is currently muted). "descriptions": Textual descriptions of the visual component of a video; meant for use with audio synthesis when the visual component is unavailable (for example, for users who are blind, or for users who are currently unable to view the screen on which the video is displayed—for example, a user accessing the video while driving a car). "chapters": Chapter titles. "metadata": Metadata content meant for use from script.

property.name: description
property.content: The language of the timed track.

property.name: description
property.content: Instructs the UA that the track is to be enabled if the user’s preferences do not indicate that another track would be more appropriate.

property.name: content
property.content: Non-empty URL potentially surrounded by spaces

property.name: description
property.content: The address of an image file for the UA to show while no video data is available.

property.name: description
property.content: Represents the default state of the audio channel of the video, potentially overriding user preferences.

property.name: description
property.content: A key label or list of key labels with which to associate the element; each key label represents a keyboard shortcut which UAs can use to activate the element or give focus to the element.

property.name: Mobile considerations
property.content: Assign access keys to links in navigational menus and frequently accessed functionality.

property.name: description
property.content: A name of a classification, or list of names of classifications, to which the element belongs.

property.name: QA Tip
property.content: Use class with semantics in mind

property.name: description
property.content: Specifies whether the contents of the element are editable.

property.name: description
property.content: The value of the id attribute on the menu with which to associate the element as a context menu.

property.name: Accessibility techniques
property.content: Using the dir attribute on an inline element to resolve problems with nested directional runs

property.name: Internationalization
property.content: Creating HTML Pages in Arabic, Hebrew and Other Right-to-left Scripts

property.name: description
property.content: Specifies whether the element is draggable.

property.name: description
property.content: Specifies what types of content can be dropped on the element, and instructs the UA about which actions to take with content when it is dropped on the element.

property.name: description
property.content: Specifies that the element represents an element that is not yet, or is no longer, relevant.

property.name: description
property.content: A unique identifier for the element.

property.name: Accessibility techniques
property.content: Using id and headers attributes to associate data cells with header cells in data tables
Using label elements to associate text labels with form controls
Ensuring that id attributes are unique on a Web page

property.name: description
property.content: Specifies the primary language for the contents of the element and for any of the element’s attributes that contain text.

property.name: Accessibility techniques
property.content: Using language attributes on the html element
Using language attributes to identify changes in the human language

property.name: Internationalization
property.content: Declaring Language in XHTML and HTML

property.name: description
property.content: Specifies whether the element represents an element whose contents are subject to spell checking and grammar checking.

property.name: description
property.content: Specifies zero or more CSS declarations that apply to the element [CSS].

property.name: description
property.content: Specifies whether the element represents an element that is is focusable (that is, an element which is part of the sequence of focusable elements in the document), and the relative order of the element in the sequence of focusable elements in the document.

property.name: Accessibility techniques
property.content: Creating a logical tab order through links, form controls, and objects

property.name: Mobile considerations
property.content: Create a logical order through links, form controls and objects.

property.name: description
property.content: Advisory information associated with the element.

property.name: Accessibility techniques
property.content: Using the title attribute of the frame and iframe elements
Supplementing link text with the title attribute
Using the title attribute to provide context-sensitive help
Using the title attribute to identify form controls when the label element cannot be used
Providing a title using the title element
Using HTML form controls and links

property.name: description
property.content: Load of element was aborted by the user.

property.name: description
property.content: The UA can resume playback of media data for this video or audio element, but estimates that if playback were to be started now, the video or audio could not be rendered at the current playback rate up to its end without having to stop for further buffering of content.

property.name: description
property.content: The UA estimates that if playback were to be started now, the video or audio element could be rendered at the current playback rate all the way to its end without having to stop for further buffering

property.name: description
property.content: User committed a change to the value of element (form control).

property.name: description
property.content: User pressed pointer button down and released pointer button over element, or otherwise activated the pointer in a manner that emulates such an action.

property.name: description
property.content: User requested the context menu for element.

property.name: description
property.content: User clicked pointer button twice over element, or otherwise activated the pointer in a manner that simulates such an action.

property.name: description
property.content: User is continuing to drag element.

property.name: description
property.content: User is continuing drag operation over element.

property.name: description
property.content: User completed drop operation over element.

property.name: description
property.content: The DOM attribute duration on the video or audio element has been updated.

property.name: description
property.content: The video or audio element has returned to the uninitialized state.

property.name: description
property.content: The end of the video or audio element has been reached.

property.name: description
property.content: User changed the value of element (form control).

property.name: description
property.content: Element (form control) did not meet validity constraints.

property.name: description
property.content: User pressed down a key that is associated with a character value.

property.name: description
property.content: UA can render the video or audio element at the current playback position for the first time.

property.name: description
property.content: UA has just determined the duration and dimensions of the video or audio element.

property.name: description
property.content: UA has begun looking for media data in the video or audio element.

property.name: description
property.content: User pressed down pointer button over element.

property.name: description
property.content: User moved pointer off boundaries of element.

property.name: description
property.content: User moved pointer into boundaries of element or one of its descendant elements.

property.name: description
property.content: User released pointer button over element.

property.name: description
property.content: User rotated wheel of mouse or other device in a manner that emulates such an action.

property.name: description
property.content: User has paused playback of the video or audio element.

property.name: description
property.content: UA has initiated playback of the video or audio element.

property.name: description
property.content: Playback of the video or audio element has started.

property.name: description
property.content: UA is fetching media data for the video or audio element.

property.name: description
property.content: Either the DOM attribute defaultPlaybackRate or the DOM attribute playbackRate on the video or audio element has been updated.

property.name: description
property.content: Element and all its subresources have finished loading.

property.name: description
property.content: Element or document view was scrolled.

property.name: description
property.content: The value of the IDL attribute seeking changed to false (a seek operation on the video or audio element ended).

property.name: description
property.content: The value of the IDL attribute seeking changed to true, and the seek operation on the video or audio elements is taking long enough that the UA has time to fire the seeking event.

property.name: description
property.content: User requested the element be shown as a context menu.

property.name: description
property.content: UA is attempting to fetch media data for the video or audio element, but that data is not forthcoming.

property.name: description
property.content: UA is intentionally not currently fetching media data for the video or audio element, but does not yet have the entire contents downloaded.

property.name: description
property.content: The current playback position of the video or audio element changed either as part of normal playback, or in an especially interesting way (for example, discontinuously).

property.name: description
property.content: Either the DOM attribute volume or the DOM attribute muted on the video or audio element has been changed.

property.name: description
property.content: Playback of the video or audio element has stopped because the next frame is not yet available (but UA agent expects that frame to become available in due course).

property.name: description
property.content: As defined in the XML specification [XML].
